name: High Resolution Time API
description: Method to provide the current time in sub-millisecond resolution and such that it is not subject to system clock skew or adjustments. Called using `performance.now()`

notes.general: The timestamp is not actually high-resolution. To mitigate security threats such as Spectre, browsers currently round the result to varying degrees.

byNum.1: In Firefox 55-57, the `privacy.resistFingerprinting` preference can be enabled to change the precision to 100ms.
byNum.2: In Firefox, the `privacy.resistFingerprinting` preference can be enabled to change the precision to 100ms or the value of `privacy.resistFingerprinting.reduceTimerPrecision.microseconds`, whichever is larger.
byNum.3: In Firefox 58-59, the `privacy.reduceTimerPrecision` preference is enabled by default and defaults to 20us.
byNum.4: In Firefox, the `privacy.reduceTimerPrecision` preference is enabled by default and defaults to 2ms.
